skillTree.localised_description: One of the Golden Magus' most infamous creations, this fiery curved sword is kept most of the time inside a jar filled with a slimy orange solution. When drawn out of it, the sword catches a mystical fire that the Magus' uses for battle, theatrics and summoning Djinn spirits. Contrary to popular belief, the ship is named after the sword.

The Magus' ostentatious golden robes are not just a flamboyant show of wealth, they possess potent enchantments that the Magus discovered in a parchment at the ruined city of Bel-Aliad. Besides providing protection from harm, these wards are curiously nocive to the Undead.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

skillTree.localised_description: Though vigorous for his old age, the Golden Magus often rides to battle on one of his many camels - out of flamboyance if anything else.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Much like the Magus' infamous flagship, this enchanted skiff is proof of his mastery over the Djinn. This is one of the Golden Magus' favourite ways to ride to battle.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is always flying and cannot land.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fire while on the move.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: This one ensures that those captured in battle wished they'd died on the field, so great is the cruelty that awaits them.
The Golden Magus personally hand selects the ogres that will serve under him. This ensures that only the most brutish and blood-thirsty of their ilk fill his ranks.
Even from within their vessels the Djinn will protect their masters.
The relentless drive and fury of the elemental spirits, harnessed for the protection of this wardâ€™s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Golden Magus' mastery over the elements of air, fire and water is exceptional, especially for a human. His powers come from his most prized possessions, 3 Royal Djinns from who he draws his magical might from.

effects.description: Attribute: Mastery of the Elemental Winds

related_attributes.bullet_text: When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.

effects.description:
Attribute: Mastery of the Elemental Winds for embedded Magician Heroes
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.

skillTree.localised_description: The Magus has enslaved many a Djinn to his will, to such degree that they cannot reject any of his wishes and commands. Djinns though are capricious and free-spirited entities, and their service should not be taken for granted.
For someone who cultivates the image of an elderly eccentric scholar, the Golden Magus is surprisingly spry, fast and adept at combat.

The Golden Magus is an expert in the art of binding the elemental spirits known as "Djinns" to his will. Stored in the Magus' flagship are thousands of warded urns, each containing a potent Djinn ready and willing to obey his every command.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2 for Arabyan Flying Carpets, Genies & Khimar al-Nar
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -25% for Arabyan Flying Carpets, Genies & Khimar al-Nar
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The secret of the Golden Magus' sorcerous might resides in his connection, or "aethyric tether" with 3 magic urns in his possession. Imprisoned inside are 3 powerful elemental spirits, siphoned of their power for the Magus' benefit.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Golden Magus can impart much knowledge onto those aspirants willing to learn the sorcerous arts - if they can stand the eccentric nature of his lessons and the Magus' ever so condescending manners.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Magicians
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Some whisper that the Magus is in complete thrall of the malignant Architect of Fate. Nonsense, of course, but like with all good rumours, there's might be a grain of truth to it...

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: Without a doubt, the Sultan of the Seas is a powerful sorcerer. Besides Djinn, however, he can also bind darker beings. This power is granted to him by his supposedly true master, the Chaos God Tzeentch.

effects.description:
Barrier: +10% for Tzeentch Daemon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Tzeentch Daemon units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Tzeentch Daemon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Harmonic Convergence"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Harmonic Convergence Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Harmonic Convergence Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: No matter how far away, none can escape the Kiss of the Deep, nor breathe again with lungs full of seawater.
The tidal currents shall slow the foe's advance.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Tidecall Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: All manner of creatures infest the deep, many who have never - and should never - be seen above the waves.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Rotting Prometheans

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Denizens of the Deep"

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Warriors of great armies are decorated in ornate armour taken from the Sultan's personal armory, even the slaves!

skillTree.localised_description: The sand dunes are so large that a man can only cross them with his trusty mount.

skillTree.localised_description: Hit and run tactics work especially well in the desert. That's why the horsemen of Araby are particularly skilled marksmen.

skillTree.localised_description: Years of training and fighting in the scorching desert sun creates exceptionally tough fighters.

skillTree.localised_description: The powerful Djinns and various other monstrous creatures are fielded to destroy the enemies of Araby.

skillTree.localised_description: Veterans among the settled peoples, or "hadir", of Araby are able to be bestowed with titles and finery befitting their contribution to these great lands.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Slave Rabble, Warriors, Spearmen, Bowmen, Corsairs, Pit-Fighters, Palace Guards, Arabyan Knights, Camel Cataphracts, Scorpion, Grand Bombard and Naphtha Thrower units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: You have seen many brothers fall in battle, for that is what the nomads are, my brothers.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Nomad Trackers, Jezzails, Southlands Warriors, Camel Lancers, Desert Riders, Camel Archers and Camel Jezzails units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: You are wise in the ways of magic and have much to teach others.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Dervishers, Enchanted Ropes, Genie, Desert Spirit, Fire Efreet, Sea Nymph, Tempest Djinn, Flying Carpets and Djinn Carriage units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: They call him the beast whisperer, for these creatures would truly die for him.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Waghzen, Elephants, War Elephant and Feral Giant Vulture units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Waghzen, Elephants, War Elephant and Feral Giant Vulture units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +15% for all beast units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Every wound that is not fatal is but a lesson to learn from.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: Whether out of fear or conviction, this leader is able to rally a relentless force behind him.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: Led by the seafaring Golden Magus these veteran sailors have been far and wide in search of gold and glory.

effects.description: Sultan of the Seas: Destroy, sack, hunt treasure and raid to build a reputation at sea versus other Vampire Coast factions and collect Sea Shanties
Diplomatic relations: +50 with the faction of Pirates of Sartosa

Immune to High Seas, Reef and Storm attrition
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: One of the Golden Magus' most infamous creations, this fiery curved sword is kept most of the time inside a jar filled with a slimy orange solution. When drawn out of it, the sword catches a mystical fire that the Magus' uses for battle, theatrics and summoning Djinn. Contrary to popular belief, the ship is named after the sword.

item_set.name: Golden Talismans
item_set.description: The Magus' ornate creations are both powerful and stylish.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +6 when fighting at sea
	(all armies factionwide)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Beneath all the eccentricity and gaudiness hides a callous corsair, eager to bring more magical treasures to his collection, more slaves to his servitude, more concubines to his harem and more power to himself.

effects.description:
Enables flaming and magical attacks for Corsairs units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +20% for Corsairs units
	(Lord's army)
